Virgo Framework Installation

Steps:

  • 1. Fork the Virgo Framework repository. Click here
  • 2. Clone your fork
  • 3. Install dependencies
  • 4. Run the development server

Cloning Fork

**Note that you can change the name of the Forked repository. Just go to your fork on Github and navigate to settings and change the Repository name.

Create a new Folder and open it in your terminal. Do not forget the "." at the end.

                    
# terminal

git clone https://github.com/your-username/repo-name.git .

Installing Dependencies

Create a virtual environment and activate it

Navigate to your project directory and install the required dependencies:

                    
# terminal

python -m venv venv
venv/scripts/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt

Running the Development Server

Start the development server using the Virgo CLI:

                    
# terminal

py virgo.py lightserve
